title: Why not give Fervor a BONUS AD ratio?
body:
Lower the base damage, hell, just remove it and add a bonus AD ratio. Nothing super huge, maybe something like 0.065% of Bonus AD per stack. Most AD champions have a base AD of around 90 - 110 by level 18. and most adcs have around 200 - 300 bonus AD by then. If you have 200 BONUS AD, Fervor will deal 104 damage per auto attack at MAX stacks. if you have 300, then it will deal 152. Maybe instead of 0.065 it could be slightly lower, like 0.06. But you understand. At level 18 the base damage for Fervor is around 111. It's also possible to have an even lower ratio but halven the base damages.

The purpose for this is to prevent champions that are taking fervor and building tank whilst doing lots of damage (Tanksuo/Tank Ekko) from abusing Fervor.

the reason why you would use deathfire and thunderlords over fervor is that because until you reach late game and have an auto attack rating of 1.5 or higher you're never going to get max stacks (unless the timer resets). There are more examples of marksmen who can benefit from deathfire than just jhin. Ezreal can use it. Jinx can use it. Really any champion with those half and half stats like Ashe teemo Tristana varus Lucian. They can all use it. The only marksmen that can't benefit from it are the ones that don't have any directly damaging abilities. Like caitlyns snap trap, but her net is magic based and with fervor you're never going to get full benefit. Deathfire makes her net burn the opponent for 60% of her  bonus attack damage and 25% ability power. That's like 2 headshots in a row. Toss out a snap trap 3 headshots. Yes thunderlords has a high cool down, but certain champs can benefit from it too because in order to get thunderlords you have to go down the cunning skill tree. Meaning you would build differently from your ferocity skill tree. You'd build with poking in mind and you'd have the option to get dual penetration or cool down reduction. That's the benefit. You'd build slightly off damage which is really useful if your team doesn't have enough AP because mid top and jungler all chose AD champs. You don't have to get kills to win. You just have to spend more time in lane as an ADC than your opponent. Kills can quicken the process but it can also cause you to die and miss last hits. If you're in lane and your opponent is in lane you're not going to be able to just sit there and auto attack him until he dies. Especially early game. Thunderlords lets you sit back and relax in lane.

When I all in early I usually have max stacks. 10 - 110 damage on auto attacks (from early to late) is much better than a 25 - 15 second CD burst mastery with good base dmg but terrible scaling and better than a mastery that requires abilities to proc and has a terrible base damage despite ADCs having almost ALL their damage from AAs.
No offense but you're Bronze 5 with a 38% win rate. Everyone deserves an opinion but I was wondering as to how anyone can think about DFT being better than Fervor in any situation besides poking. Even then the damage from DFT is VERY NEGLIGIBLE early game.

Okay so when you get 1 stack which falls off in 6 seconds if you get your second stack before end of the first stack you'll have 2 stacks that wont go back down to 1 until the 2nd stacks timer reaches zero and then the 1st stack will start its falloff timer over at 6 seconds? Is that right?

I don't know why so many pros play with fervor honestly. Maybe because they're under pressure to win and they go with whatever is easiest to use or maybe it's because they like fervor more for their builds because their builds use attack speed and critical? I don't know. You'll have to ask the professionals. professionals don't like to experiment I wouldn't think. After all it is their job to win so whatever gets them that win the fastest with the least difficulty is probably what they do.

fervor lets a marksman (marksman for ADC) get free damage for playing aggressively. Works best on marksmen who already have high attack speed and should be built alongside lifesteal and movement speed to allow auto attack kiting, sustain, and quick escapes because any enemy with armor will cause issues.

deathfire does a lot of things. It's not one dimensional like fervor. Deathfire for example allows any player to stop their opponent from healing. If you combine deathfire with corrupting potion the sorcery skill double edged sword and natural talent and piercing thoughts instead of battering blows you can do more damage with lets say... Ezreals E which normally doesn't do squat. And losing out on that 7% armor penetration is nothing. If you're buying items like yoomuus and other items that give flat penetration you don't need percent penetration. And vice versa. That goes for runes masteries and item builds. 

It doesn't matter how much armor penetration you have if your abilities are magic based. Lots of marksmen have at least 1 magic damage ability. Now I don't know if lets say... Static shiv or rapid firecannon which both do magic damage gets benefit from the magic penetration. If they do then that's even more reason to consider using the magic percent penetration.

as for why use thunderlords? Thunderlords requires you to sacrifice up front damage potential for flat scaling penetration movement speed biscuits or more damage when solo laning while bards roaming. Mana regen for Lucian extra damage on jhins... Everything with the more damage to low hp enemies. Health and mana on assists and kills providing extra sustain gold in case you miss your last hits cool down so  you can snipe with cait and Ashe more. Every third attack within a cool down range you successfully land on the same enemy champion will grant you a free aoe that does magic to all enemies in the area. A basic attack early game is pretty weak. Maybe 60 hp per shot. So like 10 basic attacks to kill an enemy who isn't fighting back with fervor takes 7 shots depending on criticals and armor penetration. 30% of 75 is about 15 damage. 10% of the 10 you get if you choose natural talent is 1 more. Add the ten per level and at 18 youre doing an aoe of 200 magic damage every 20 seconds just from thunderlords and 1 damage item. So even if your enemies buy armor you'll still have a way to deal reliable sustained damage. 

in short what I mean is that while yes fervor allows brain dead monkeys damage output it doesn't mean that it's the end all to every marksman. Twitch comes to mind when thinking about thunderlords. Corki comes to mind when thinking about thunderlords. Kogmaw. 

the way I was imagining the Caitlyn thing was like this caitlyn fires a net from a bush > net hits target > applies deathfire for 4 seconds from net > Caitlyn shoots a headshot from the net > Caitlyn drops a snaptrap at her opponents feet > snaptrap grants another headshot > Caitlyn has 4 basic attack stacks from being in a bush and auto attacks again gaining her last two stacks > opponent starts moving > Caitlyn fires her headshot > if opponent lives Caitlyn can Q applying another deathfire for 2 seconds > if opponent doesn't die Caitlyn can use her R which applies another 4 second deathfire

if it doesn't work that way then explain why so I can get better.

just because I'm bronze doesn't mean I can't be decent at the game. There  are hundreds of reasons why someone might be stuck in a lower bracket and no im not talking about trolls and afkers. Connection is one. PC specs is another. Time is another still. I've had my account since this game was released. I automatically get put into bronze when I qualify because that's where I was when I qualified over 6 years ago and I don't care enough to deal with the rage filled community that digs it's own grave. At least in publics, aram, tree line, and weekend medley I get to play without having to see someone accuse someone of trolling or feeding or seeing gg appear at 30 seconds in the chat log. If you look at my ranked match history you'll see that I have done very well in matches I've won and sometimes even in games I've lost. What you don't see is that I play with frame issues. That I play with connection issues. That my settings have to be on very low because my PC can't handle all of the animations and particle effects so I miss some of the visuals. You don't see that I have trouble distinguishing shades of blue from shades of purple grey and black. What you can see is that I have played just barely over 100 games and I have won 43 of them.  100 games since the season started 5 or so months ago. You can see my builds and my deaths. You can't see the role I was given the compromises that had to take place and the amount of hatred spewed everywhere in chat like a fire hose of sewage.

while I admit that I don't know everything about this game and that I'm in no way interested in becoming challenger tier that doesn't automatically mean what I do know is wrong. I may have some incorrect information at times but that doesn't mean I'm unskilled. It means I don't care about this game to stay on top of every little update and detail. This game isn't even my second hobby. Its like the 5th or 6th, but it's free and easy to play and the community is mostly around my age so every few months I come back to it.

No I don't think that each Fervor stack is removed every 6 seconds, I think it's all at once.

The reason why you don't know why pros use Fervor is because you still don't understand the potential with Fervor. The pros aren't stressed  or under pressure, they use Fervor because it's the BEST keystone for nearly all AD autoattack based champions. Yes pros experiment sometimes but the pros have consistently used Fervor on ADCs for months now. Hell, even Koreans experiment the most and they always take Fervor.

If anything Deathfire is more brain-dead than Fervor. You use an ability and get free damage after. With Fervor at least there is a stacking mechanic. Also you do know that you have 30 mastery points right? Meaning you can fill one mastery tree and 2/3 of another one? Meaning you don't have to sacrifice all the things in the tree you're not putting your keystone in. And is that tiny bit of extra damage worth it on the Ezreal E? The masteries you listed besides Deathfire can also increase Fervor and AA damage (besides the mpen mastery and sorcery, you can take the armor pen and attk speed instead.) Would you prefer 7% armor pen to increase damage on every auto that can potentially crit dealing 800+ damage? Or do you want the 7% magic pen which will only help a select few abilities that normally have a very long cool down. The armor pen obviously. Plus percent pen is much better vs tanks than flat pen.
